column4: okay, I have a question, I installed the netbook edition of 10.10 and it's different, I think I can get used to it, but I would like a real applications drop down (sorta like a start menu) is there a way to enable or add this?
I ended up just using the ubuntu desktop edition...
you don't have to reinstall.  Just logout, and relogin, selecting "Ubuntu Desktop Edition" as your session type
I found it annoying that the netbook edition isn't very configurable
I chose the netbook because of my crappy resolution on this dell.  I like the icons on the side, but dang, they should have made that ubuntu symbol at the top the applications menu.
the desktop edition is quite configurable... you can drag the panel to the left side, etc.
and you can increase the size of icons if you like
(you unlock things by right-clicking, and then clicking unlock)
I tried that, didn't like how the icons/tabs looked.  Maybe I should try something like docky on the side?
I'm surprised it looked bad... perhaps you need to make the size an even multiple of 12 to get it to look good?
(to get the icons to look good)
thor needlez :thanks, I will check that out.
just didn't like the text on the icons and having to make them too wide so they weren't truncated.
you can have just the ubuntu menu, without "Applications, Places, System"
I just found a ubuntu based distro that I'm trying in virtual box to see if I like it.  Ultimate-Edition
I will try that out again, I haven't tried it in 10.10, I think it was 8.x that I last tried the icons on the side (before I try cario)
